newsitem.title: ISRAEL: RESEARCH ALERT-Israeli banks to outperform market.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Israeli banks to outperform market.

text.p: Salomon Brothers said in a report on Wednesday it was maintaining buy recommendations on three Israeli banks despite a recent sharp run-up in their share prices.
Analyst Matthew Czepliewicz said shares were "steaming ahead" despite the strong performance over the last 12 weeks for First International Bank of Israel, Bank Hapoalim and Bank Leumi.
"A share pause may be inevitable before long," he said. "Yet banking condition should be largely benign in 1997 and 1998, with the possible exception of slower GDP growth this year."

He said the banks had begun to reverse the trend of narrower net interest margins that characterised the first half of the 1990s. He said the banks' securities business would see modest improvement this year after a depressed 1996.

Czepliewicz noted that bank reform legislation, which forced the banks to reduce their non-bank holdings, could result in a big dividend payout. A full payout of taxed capital gains would boost the dividend yield by 5.8 percent at Leumi and 1.7 percent at Hapoalim.
"With the Middle East peace process back on track, one of the dark clouds overhanging the market has dissipated," he added.
